Reviews.Title: “carolina heredia”
Reviews.Author: Carolina313
Reviews.Content: room pasha for 5, very nice, very clean, nice people.. they have a fresh breakfast.. we loved it

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: MrHeckler
Reviews.Content: Cons: On entering, the welcoming reception was cold - the reception staff was not friendly. The bathroom in our room was not clean. During the night, the reception staff was talking loudly (interrupting our sleep from time to time). Pros: The room was very big and had good heating.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel-mar2012 26-29”
Reviews.Author: miron307
Reviews.Content: very nice clean family hotel good breakfeast,thank you,tuchinskiy miron &tatyana,usa

Reviews.Title: “Close, affordable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sunnytraveller_11
Reviews.Content: Mystic Hotel is close to everything (5 min walk) you want to see in Sultanahmet: Blue Mosque, Ayasophia, main shops, bazaars, restaurants and bathhouses etc. Mystic Hotel is a family run hotel and feels like home. The family is very welcoming and hospitable. Its wooden floors and space is warmly decorated, the rooms are clean and well kept. The hot water is always hot! (which is great). The breakfast buffet is nice - everything you need to set you up for the morning! And importantly for me the wifi worked excellently on each floor. Perfect! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service Ä° Feeled as like my home”
Reviews.Author: Jkllhgg
Reviews.Content: Special Thanks For Mr oktay and family member for hospitaltly i enjoyed my during my one week stay thanks a lot again see u next time

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: N C
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Istanblul. We spent there three nights in September. Hotel is located in the heart of Sultanahmet within walking distance to all main attractions. Room was not big but with enough space for two people to feel comfortable and was cleaned daily. Price was affordable too. There was a delicious breakfast served every morning on the terrace from which you can see the Sea of Marmara. The owner, Oktay, organized our pickup and drop off at the airport. He took his time to show us the best and closest restaurant to eat and even gave us a little sightseeing tour. He and his family made us feel very welcomed at their hotel. We cannot wait to go back again as there are so many things to do and places to see in Istanbul. We will definitely stay at the Mystic Hotel again. Thank you, Oktay.

Reviews.Title: “thanks alot for the best reliable hotel”
Reviews.Author: farshid h
Reviews.Content: my husband and I spent our 2week-honeymoon in mystic hotel in istanbul turkey.we were happy with the mystic hotel and enjoyed the stay there.the room was clean and the manager and his family were reliable.we would never forgot their kindness.thank you mystic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cam510
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here during our recent trip to Istanbul, and had a very good experience. We looked out over roof tops towards the water which was a gorgeous view. The room was kind of small, but that didn't pose any problems. And yes, the sink was in the shower, but again, it was not the end of the world. The family who runs the hotel was extremely nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DAFFSPERTH
Reviews.Content: We where put in this "hell hole" as our hotel (up the road) was booked. Luck for us only one night. The room was dirty,musty smell, some the electric cords where not safe and where covered by tape. The bathroom was dirty,mouldy and when you showered the toilet got soaked as it was not seperated from the shower, therefore, the toilet paper was kept near the old and delapidated basin (not within reach from toilet seat). The owner was pleasant but we could not wait to get out of there. Not sure what the other rooms where like but ours was a shocker.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Family”
Reviews.Author: Glenn F
Reviews.Content: There are two things that made our stay in the Mystic hotel delightful. One is its location - its in one of the many small streets located in the Sultanahmet area. And it iis within walking distance - and this a leisurely stroll , not a forced march with packed rations - of the most iconic sites in the area; Blue Mosque, Sophia Hagia etc. Second is the owner manager, Oktay and his family. From organising pickup/dropoff at the airport, to helping with a day trip he was always very helpful. His charming daughters were also helpful in navigating us in person to a restaurant, our first evening there, when we were still clueless about directions. Our room was a little cramped for a family of 4 (esp. as we there for 5 nights), but we booked late - there were slightly larger rooms - so booking ahead would have helped us in this case. Despite that, the location and friendly help more than made up for it. We enjoyed Istanbul grealty and if we return we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming family right in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Christele0811
Reviews.Content: We made an excellent stay in Istanbul. Mystic Hotel is situated well right in the heart of Sultanahmet just a step from the Blue Mosque. The family which holds the hotel is particularly charming and welcoming. Oktay BALKIR, master of places, will lavish you of good advice - in English or in French! - to pursue your stay in Turkey by recommending the good addresses (in particular for baklavas!)! The hotel is clean) and certain rooms offer a sight on the Sea of Marmara. A good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel at the heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: Werner S
Reviews.Content: We had tree great days at this nice and cosy hotel. Good breakfast with the sea of Marmaris at your feet, included. There is just a few minutes walking distance to almost everything that counts. For excursions to more distant objects the tram station close to the hotel comes in handy. Rooms are clean, bathrooms ok. The owner and his family have a pleasant and service minded approach. We felt really taken care of during our stay. Just go there and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “well situated hotel to discover Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: paula f
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Mystic Hotel. It is a nice en welsituated hotel between the blue mosque and the grand bazaar. Both at 5 minutes walking distance. The hotel was also near to a beautifull mosque, the Mehmet Pasa mosque. The room had a great view at the Marmaris sea en was clean, airconditioning and tv. The bathroom was OK. and breakfast was nice (included). The owner was very friendly and helpfull. It was a great place to discover Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “we loved thÄ±s hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenny1233
Reviews.Content: mystÄ±c hotel Ä±s an authentÄ±c and famÄ±ly atmosfe.Oktay Ä±s very helpful and gÄ±ves nÄ±ce hospÄ±talÄ±ty.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and will go back !!”
Reviews.Author: Mariiam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located near a lot of places (Sultan Ahmet, Aya Sophia, Grand bazar) Great for tourists. I loved all the little quirky details, our room was clean and tidy, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was extremely clean. The owner of the hotel and all his family was welcoming, helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. We enjoyed our stay and had fun !!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: carla587
Reviews.Content: Mystic Hotel is situated in the old town of Istanbul, a quiet area near to most of the monuments and museums (to arrive to ayasofia it takes you just 5 minutes by walk), and near to the metro and to the bus stations too. the staff is very kind and polite, and the service is perfect! i recommend it to all people who's looking for a hotel in Istanbul with all the facilietes!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, family-run, good value in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Melzack2011
Reviews.Content: Oktay Balkir, the owner, arranged a pick-up from the airport for us and suggested aplace for us to eat that evening and then his daughters showed us the way. Another night he booked us into a fish restaurant which runs a free taxi service for customers. This set the standard of service all the way through our 10 days stay in late April. We had to move rooms 3 times as we had booked late and although there was space specific rooms had been booked by other travellers. It was really no problem - a lovely way to see different rooms in the hotel and our bags were moved each time. The family was really helpful with directions and advice, also with polishing up my Turkish phrases and making me practice! All the rooms had their diferent advantages - we liked the last room at the top of the house best as most spacious and a real bird's eye view of the ferry port and the Marmara Sea. Breakfast was a Turkish feast of fruit, bread, dishes like ravioli and tabbouleh, olives, cheese, cold meat, boild eggs etc with tea, coffee, chocolate. It's in an ideal location, in a little back street in Sultanahmet where children played marbles in the evening, just a few minutes from the Blue Mosque one way and the tram line and the Gran Bazaar the other. We couldn't have found a more perfect place. We left carrying several kilos of hazel nuts, a gift from the family. Bey Oktay got up at 5 in the morning to open the door and help us into the taxi on our last morning. Service in a grand hotel couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Value Stay at mystic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonie0317
Reviews.Content: Mystic hotel is a family hotel runned by Oktay. The room we had was big for two person. The place is clean but the shower area was a bit small to move around but the whole bathroom was huge. Shower pressure was great. Oktay was very helpful in answering our inquiry regarding going around sulthanamet. the place was near to almost all the attraction in the old city. Breakfast was always the same each morning, well you can not expect more for the budget rate they offer, the room heater was not working that it was too cold in the evening.Good thing the blankets was a bit thick. Oktay's daugthers was so friendly that they are our newest friends in Istanbul, Begum was so kind to do a reservation for us in one resturant. For budget travellers the place is a great deal. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume_11
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple of french students. When we arrived at the hotel, we were quit lost in this beautiful city but day by day, this peaceful hotel became a friendly base where we rested, talked and learne a bit more about the owner's family. I think the most important thing a hotel might propose you, is to be a refuge, and this hotel had been one to us. Perfect for travellers and human being. Zeus room has a very nice sea view. Thanks for all. Good Luck. Guillaume and Juliette.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic......”
Reviews.Author: ghoghnoss
Reviews.Content: I loved its atmosphere Mr.Oktay Related to us such as his Friend and we shared many topics together. Break fast were so good, And i cannot forget his wife My dear Sevim, who was so nice person ,im not able to discribe, i love to be there as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good time!!!”
Reviews.Author: gallery3117
Reviews.Content: We are a traveling family from Nz and have traveled exstensivley. We always look for the best affordable accommodation and where we can experience the culture of the country we are visiting. "The Mystic Hotel" went out of its way to make us feel welcome and comfortable even a guided walk the first morning,( boss had time) on one quiet night at the hotel the family cooked us barbacue, how many places do that today.We had a wonderful time and could share many more stories with "trip adviser".

Reviews.Title: “mystic is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: alina_gr_rh
Reviews.Content: Mystic hotel is a family run business. Oktay, the owner, is an extremely nice and helpful man, very resourceful for all the guidance we needed for an autonomous discovery of the city, very efficient and able for an individualized tailoring of our travelling agenda. The breakfast is healthy vegetables and bread, butter, marmelade. The rooms are very clean, with comfortable space, best view to Marmara sea and panorama of city, amazingly quiet although in the heart of the historical area. The hotel is really in walking distance from all major sights of the city like Agia Sofia, Top kapi, Blue Mosque, archeological museum. I recommend mystic hotel for everybody that wants a great price, great location, great view and clean, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok just for sleeping in but we left before our stay was over.”
Reviews.Author: tank87
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was brilliant, only a short walk and you were in the centre with easy access to the blue mosque etc We tried the breakfast on our first morning and didnt have it again, it was simply some cheese, jam and bread. We felt like the owner took an instant dislike to us from the moment we asked for one additional towel for the room, there was one towel each but the heating wasnt on in the room and since it was february and raining terribly outside we couldnt get the towels dry for the morning. The owner never said hello, goodbye anything to us for the rest of our stay. The room was quite spacious compared to our friends room across the hall, however the bathroom door would not shut unless you used all your strength and slammed it. After flushing the toilet it made should a loud noise for at least 20mins before it would finally stop....do not flush the toilet in the middle of the night...ull never get back to sleep!!! The floor around the toilet was ALWAYS wet, we couldnt work out whether this was coming from the toilet or the shower which is practically touching the toilet. We would leave the hotel first thing in the morning and not arrive back until late at night, so it was just a place to sleep, which will be the same for majority of people staying in Istanbul, however I think next time I would prefer to find a different hotel but if you dont mind where you stay and want something solely for location you should be able to put up with this hotel for a couple of nights...we managed 2 out of 4 nights before moving on...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and relaxed atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: psypunk
Reviews.Content: A great family run hotel. Comfortable, friendly and relaxed atmosphere. We found that everyone was very helpful and welcoming and the location, right next to the blue mosque and aya sofia was perfect. For a nice, reasonable stay in Istanbul you should look no further.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to rest”
Reviews.Author: magalicairo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in Mystic hotel in a double room called "Pingouins". the bedroom was small but very quiet and clean with a beautiful view on the marmara sea. A very peaceful and familial atmosphere. The owner speaks french fluently . He is a very nice man, very helpful, giving good advises. The hotel is ruled by the whole family (but not sure his wife really enjoys her work there... ) A bit deceived by the terrace which is very small . Nevertheless, we ve appreciated the simple but very good breakfast, every morning. A last but very important point :the hotel is very well located. it is near everything (tram, main street, blue mosquee, aya sophie, sultanhamet...) and in the same time it is in a very quiet street. A place to remember for next stays in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorp1
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay in Mystic hotel. First time May 2010 we stayed with my friend, second time i was with husband, sister and friend, and everyone liked this hotel!!!! Excellent location - 3min walk to Sultanahmet tram station, Blue Mosque, etc. Very friendly owner Oktay Balkir, can arrange bus tickets, taxi, airpost shuttle, and many options to spent a very good time in beautiful Istanbul. Highly recommend to everyone who needs friendly, clean, good located places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly , dirty and creepy”
Reviews.Author: faro83
Reviews.Content: The room was really dirty and dusty; the towers that they gave us were all with halls and not very clean. We have to requested a cloth to clean the room and to exchange the bed side lamp because was broken and again very dirty . So they gave us another one that also was broken and dusty , so we decide to not ask again.. The breakfast also was really poor; they say is served between 8 and 10. the first day we went at 9.20 and there was no much left the second day the same and the 3rd day we decide to go down 8.30, but because there is no table for all the guests we had to wait till 9.00 and this time we had to go out to buy our yogurt, cheese and some cake because it was all finish.. The tea they put 3 tea bags in the kettle in the morning and till the end of breakfast they just ad water, water ... so if you are late for breakfast you have hot water tea. I had try to explain to the owner and he was really unfriendly, no apologise at all, lseems that he was doing us a favour , He said that if we were not happy that we should go, and I would have gone but unfortunately we were asked to pay in advice. He also said that no other hotel offer the quality that he offered , so when we left to stay the last 2 days in a better hotel he start to follow us till we found a new place, me and my friend got quite scared it was quite creepy and weird. I will never go back there again, not even in a million years. I also make sure that none of my friends and relatives use these hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Shells50
Reviews.Content: We booked months in advance to stay at Tulip Hotel. When we arrived we were told our booking had been lost due to computer crash. They sent us to Mystic Hotel. Owner put us in the room he usually uses which was as the front of the hotel on ground level. The windows on to the street did not close and we were subject to noise from the hotel across the road with people checking in and out all night long. The room was not completely finished and the floor was only partly covered. There was no air conditioning or fan. The bathroom was a partitioned corner of the room and had mould in the corners. Breakfast was shocking and the lack of service was appalling. The owner's 'snooty' daughters were responsible for laying out breakfast and everything seemed to be too much trouble for them. Nothing was replenished (eg sugar, milk, bread) until they were asked. There was nothing pleasant about their demeanour. The location of the hotel was not very nice and it was a steep walk to anywhere to eat. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “tres mauvais choix”
Reviews.Author: luma28
Reviews.Content: Chambre convenable. Vue non conforme Ã  la photo. Petit dejeuner extremement leger (oeufs avariÃ©es). Avare d informations.

Reviews.Title: “hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Poussette
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed by the whole family, and given excellent tips on thesurrounding area. , restaurants etcetera. by Oktar, who speaks bothFrench and English fluently.The rooms are comfortable and well-lit, the beds:suoer comfortable and the best thing was eating breakfast on the balcony with a view of Marmares, or downing a beer while watching the sunset. We particularly liked the location, as the hotel seemed to be in the most authentic part of an otherwise touristic area. There was indeed something mystic about 'The Mystic!'. Harriet and Xavier

Reviews.Title: “Feel Istanbul's life in Mystic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Festia
Reviews.Content: We (me and four friends of mine) spend 4 days in Istanbul. We were glad to choose this simple hotel. We stayed in triple and double rooms. First of all it's perfect location!!! It's close to major attractions just 5 minutes from Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia, and 5 minutes to tram station. It's easily accessible from the airport if you ordered a shuttle or probably harder to find if you get there by yourself (it's not easy to find hotel the first time), but then you will find it easily. The area where hotel located is Sultanhamet (the most touristic place in the city) and where you can find a lot of places for dinner or just having snack. The rooms were clean, big enough for spending few nights. The bed were comfortable. Quiet and peacefull place (if not notice muezzin's calls from mosques but it's usual thing for Istanbul). Bathroom has a good condition and very big in Cleopatra's room. It was terrific to have breakfast and see roof of many houses and beautiful Marmara sea. The owner Oktay is helpful and friendly, booked us transfer from/to airport, give us some useful advices. Breakfast is very basic but ok if you remember how much you pay per night. There were delicious bread and natural yogurt, eggs, cheese, some fruits and vegetables. But some my fastidious friends were disappointed such breakfast. In conclusion, I'd like to say that quality and comfort are value money which we paid. P.S.: Don't expect a lot if you pay such price!

Reviews.Title: “Mystic”
Reviews.Author: Dreamsun_10
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent 4 days in Istanbul. First of all, I'd like to say very big "Thank you" to the owner Oktay. He helped us a lot, was very friendly, booked for us transfer from / to airport and just was nice =) Secondly, I'd like to say about location. It's close to major attractions,- just 5 minutes from Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia, and 5 minutes to tram station. We stayed in double room. The room were simple and and good standard for a hotel in quite a central location. Breakfast was very basic.There were delicious bread and natural yogurt. It would be good to have more assortment on breakfast and, of course, it was terrific to have breakfast and see roof of many houses and beautiful Marmara sea. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, warm family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Patti_DC
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very happy at the Mystic Hotel. The rooms were clean, the bed were all comfortable, and the location was both quiet and very convenient to all the sights. Oktay was so helpful in giving us directions and booking shuttles which saved us a lot of money. When my friend and I were stranded by the Iceland volcano, we were more than happy to come back to the delicious breakfasts and warm family hospitaliy. Oktay, Sevim and their two lovey daughters did so much to make us feel at home. It's not a fancy hotel, but it does not try to be. Its charm is its old fashion character.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, family run hotel on a quiet street in Sultan Ahmed; a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: niconet
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Oktay, Sevim, Begum & Beyza for my wonderful stay at their pretty hotel. Not only do each of the rooms have their own personality but they are also clean, quiet & have hot showers. Begum, I usually do not eat breakfast but yours was so inviting & delicious that I soon looked forward to it, thank you! Oktay, Thanks for all your advice on getting around & helping us out during the volcanic activity. I would certainly return to & would recommend your hotel to any of my friends or to any one else looking for a family run hotel; my favorite rooms being the ones with the Marmara view on the top two floors. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for minus a smile”
Reviews.Author: mf2hd
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small (to be expected for the price) and relatively clean. Shower has good pressure and hot water, but the shower head was broken and the shower cabin leaked water across the whole bathroom. The 'sea view' consisted of mostly roof tops and a bit of Marmar Sea with an armada of industrial ships. Hardly charming. Speaking of which, the owner family were grumpy, cold and made us feel entirely unwelcome at every chance they got. There were building works outside our window morning and evening. The walls are paper-thin so plan on joining your neighbour's conversations. This place has potential, but with the attitude and lack of taste of its owners it's not going anywhere. A smile and a helpful approach can make up for so much, but their absence here makes what little there is even less enjoyable. So even the relatively low room rate we paid seemed too high.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull experiece”
Reviews.Author: Fancy791
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the whole experience. Stayed in the hotel for 9 days and found the family to be very helpfull and pleasant. the rooms were well kept and very clean and did not have any trouble sleeping. We stayed on the second floor and our room faced the mamarin sea, lovely view of the fishing boats in the evening. The weather was something that was to be desired but found that everything was in walking distance and you could choose to take the metro or bus. The old historic area of Saltanahmet was lovely and met alot of lovely people in the area, they were very eager to help if you needed them, I would deffinetley return back to Turkey and would not hesitate to return the Mystic.... thanks for the wonderfull hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in history at the Mystic”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin68
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Mystic hotel. I found the owner and his family most helpful in helping me every time I asked for help. Breakfast was included with the room price and was nice. The room was comfortable with a decent view of the Sea of Marmara. Hotel is located with no more than a five to ten minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and the Topkapi Palace. It is about a fifteen minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. Many restaurants are located within a ten to fifteen minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Mohad
Reviews.Content: Very poor hospitality,Not so much friendly environment, which can't be expected from turkish people. Bed was not clean, no bed sheet! The family are really mystic, they are not helpful, not warm and friendly. the room was cold. They asked my friend to pay 1 TL just for 1 cup of hot water!!!!! Don't stay in top floor, since you can hear cats and birds, really annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ohsuzieQ
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I made last minute reservations in Istanbul, most places were booked because of the UEFA cup final, but we were delighted to find this little gem. The rooms are basic but clean, comfy and good value for around 55 euro. Breakfast on the terrace was a delight. And the neighborhood was fantastic - a bit of real Istanbul - just off the tourist track but near all the attractions of the old city. And the most amazing burek you will ever taste at a bakery just around the corner! (you must try it!!) Oktay accompanied me there personally and made sure I didn't have any communication problems. Oktay and his family were very polite and catered to all our needs. We booked our airport transfers and bus tickets through him at a good rate which was really convenient and he helped us carry our luggage up to the bus upon our departure. All in all I would recommend to anyone looking for low key, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean accomodation at a good price in an interesting location”
Reviews.Author: ottoretro
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the fact that taxis cannot find this hotel. Ever. The location is actually good for walking to lots of interesting sights and is well in reach of tram stations. My room was clean and warm - there were two heaters in the room and one looked to be newly installed. I never got up early enough for breakfast but the location was quiet enough to allow late sleeping. Good showers with plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The owners weren't overly friendly at first but warmed up and ended up being really helpful and welcoming - I think initial reticence is more of a cultural that personal thing. Generally it was all fine and I'd stay there again. Just mind out for the steep marble stairs - possibly treacherous for the unduly clumsy or for big drinkers!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed after good reviews”
Reviews.Author: bobcarlson
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently and were hoping for a lot after some very good reviews on here. We didn't really enjoy our stay at the hotel at all, mainly due to the room itself and the inability or unwillingness to rectify our problems. The bedding provided was dirty, insufficient for the time of year - the room was quite cold - and worst of all VERY smelly. It smelt really musty, we complained after the first night and were given more musty blankets, complained again and were given smoky ones! The breakfast is terrible. It's typical in style but the bread was stale, the olives and salad very tired and the meat very cheap. To summarise, as said by others, the breakfast is very poor, the shower exceptional and the rooms basic. Obviously, for the price we weren't expecting wonders but decent bedding is a fairly basic request. The wonderful service and great help from the owners was totally missing on our stay - in fact they were quite surly. One word of warning about the transfer to the airport. We were told it would be 30 mins max (as it was 5.40am) to the airport but it took an hour as we picked up 10 other people. Thankfully we had plenty of time but just something to be aware of if you were going to go for a tight transfer time.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul was great!”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at Mystic Hotel. The owners welcomed us warmly and they did everything to make our stay at their hotel comfortable. Breakfast at the balcony with a view over the Bosporus was great! Our room answered our needs. Mostly we were outside the hotel and saw a lot of Istanbul. Mystic Hotel is a very nice place to stay when you are in Istanbul. It is just 10 minutes walk away from the touristic places. The neighbourhood was quiet. It was if we were staying at a friend's house!

Reviews.Title: “book early ... great value for money”
Reviews.Author: fblk
Reviews.Content: We booked 9 months in advance and payed 25euros for a double room. Makes great value for money, and then you cant complain about the (relatively poor) breakfast. Rooms were decent but lacking a clean blanket. Shower was great, lots of hot water. Great service and helpful tips from the family.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel with a very warm welcome.”
Reviews.Author: JudyWSWales
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the good reviews it has received from other travellers. We did not expect 4 or 5 star facilities, but we had a very comfortable stay, and the standard of service in this hotel is among the best I have experienced anywhere. The building is old, and the stairs are quite steep, so anyone with mobility problems might want to look elsewhere. The rooms are basic, but very clean,quiet and comfortable, with a small bathroom, and our first floor room had a stunning view out over the sea. A buffet breakfast is served in the dining room overlooking the sea, and was very good indeed. The location was excellent, within 10 minutes walk of the Hippodrome, though there are 1 or 2 steep gradients to negotiate in between. Don't be put off by the area, most of Sultanahmet is undergoing renovation at the moment.The owner is very friendly and helpful so it is almost like visiting friends. If you are looking for a good,clean budget hotel in an excellent location, and you have no mobility problems, this hotel would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: caius
Reviews.Content: The owner and family made us welcomed and very helpful with information. Perfect location to explore Sultanhamet and beyond on day trips. Breakfast with a lovely view over the sea of Marmora. Internet available through wifi. Hot water throughout the day. Peace and quiet during the night. transfer from airport easily arranged. We would use it again and again

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, comfortable rooms and unbeatable, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Bintheretoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mystic for 3 weeks while working in Istanbul. I had everything that I needed - good internet on each floor, plentiful hot water, peace and quiet at night, and a gorgeous view to look at over breakfast. Oktay and his family made me feel so welcome, at "casa mia", and expertly directed me around the city and beyond on public transport. And there were always interesting people to chat to over a beer on the balcony in the evenings. Superb place, thanks Oktay!

Reviews.Title: “Suitable accomodation for modest traveller”
Reviews.Author: Kadidlo
Reviews.Content: Mystic is very well situated accomodation in the Sultanahmet quarter. All important places of interest are in a walk distance. I would reccomend this family hotel to all tourists who seek a place where to sleep overnight and have a shower after a whole day spent out in the city. The services aÅ„d breakfast are good enough. The personnel is nice and helpful and whatever you need there is no problem to arrange it. You can rely on done agreements. If you are not spoiled you will be satisfied. You can enjoy a picturesque view on the sea with ships from the eating terrace. If you are considering this hotel, no wories and take it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sabiSalalah
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istanbul. Mystic Hotel was a most wonderful place to spend my vacation nights. This quant hotel is very well situated,walking distance to many of the major sights to be seen. The hospitality was amazing. The family welcomed us and was very helpful in leading us to the places we wanted to visit. Rooms were very comfortable and the rates very reasonable. I would highly reccommend this lovely place for travellers to Istambul. Thank you for the hospitality shown to us.

Reviews.Title: “Comforatable hotel with friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: spetra
Reviews.Content: I spent in this hotel 5 days with my boyfriend. Room-Zeus in the 2nd floor with sea view, bathroom, case, bedside, cutlery, towels, all were excellent clean, good service, friendly staff . Only cover should be cleaner or coated. Hotel is near Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Yerebatan Saray and many others monuments.

Reviews.Title: “It could so easily have been brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Eurovisitor23
Reviews.Content: I read other's review about the terrible breakfasts at this hotel and did not think it would bother me at all. Unfortunately I was extremely shocked at how appalling the quality was. What a pity as this is so easily corrected to give an otherwise superb little hotel with attentive service, clean rooms and great location. Come on, sir, get your breakfast standards up and you can easily be getting 5 star from all your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed - Can Find Much Better Value in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: OysterOyster
Reviews.Content: Mystic Hotel is more of a guest house or hostel than really a hotel. It is overpriced for what it is. We stayed for 2 nights because we booked over internet. Our room had a slight musty odour, was not clean or comfortable (possibly due to the dirty carpets) , and the hotel itself was loud making it difficult to get a sound sleep (you can hear every person walk up the stairs, close doors and run their showers). One the plus side, it is well situated and serves a nice breakfast. However, for about US $15 more, we moved to a different hotel in the same area that was excellent in all respects and was overall a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “i found it very nice place to visit istanbul city”
Reviews.Author: ameer_jalal
Reviews.Content: The hotel have a nice rooms and a good services I hope from anyone visit this hotel. Mr. jalal ameer. Tripoli - Libya

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: silviot64
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Istanbul and we found in Mystic Hotel a good and friendly atmosphere. All indications they gave me were appropriates. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A very poor quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: weston505
Reviews.Content: Located at hardly accessible part of old istanbul, with no air conditioner rooms, primitive bathrooms the Mystic Hotel Istanbul is no better than a local guest house. It is far from being a boutique hotel. The owners were sulky, boring and disrespectful to their customers. They were rude and did not even greet their guests. The bathrooms lacked shower cabins. Even village houses have shower cabins today. And I doubt they have a certified hotel operating license. They ask for sky high prices though the room quality deserves not even half of what they charge. They use rubber cloth for dinning table. The hotel is not well illuminated. I do not advise any tourist to stay at this hotel. Bathrooms were not clean enough.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable family run hotel in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: WillametteValley
Reviews.Content: The Mystic Hotel is situated in the heart of the old city - a 10 minute walk from the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque. We travelled with three children and found the proprietors of the Mystic to be very accomodating, helpful and kind. The location is great, the hotel is clean, the cost was very reasonable and breakfast is taken on a terrace overlooking the Bosporus. The Mystic was comfortable and friendly - a real home from home. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Vvladka
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was clean and modern. The location is in the heart of the city in very quiet place, easy to walk to wherever you like - restaurants, museums, tram stops.... The staff spoke fluent English, were very helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a friendly atmosphere in the historical heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ifca
Reviews.Content: Mystic hotel is one of the few places where you can find peace for your relaxation in today's hurried time. This is a business of nice and kind family which will always be very happy to order anything you want to know about Istanbul. The hotel is situated directly in the historical part of Istanbul, near to Sultanahmed square, Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. Despite its location in the center is serene and thus ideal for rest. Handling hotel was nice and always very pleasant. Very tasty breakfast was served on the terrace with a panoramic view of the sea. In the hotel was also possible to buy any various drinks at the same price as the shop. We spent in Istanbul one full week and becouse of the excellent accommodation we have got the most beautiful experiences, which has never forgotten. Will be our pleasure to recommend this hotel to everyone who will decided to visit Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the place -- an the family!”
Reviews.Author: Pavlusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mystic hotel for a week in early June and it was such a good choice. Inexpensive family-run B&B in the very centre (3 minutes walk from Hippodrome), located in a quiet side street, clean and cozy, simply furnished with a nice atmposhere. Oktay and his family were so very nice and helpful, it was much more than professional kindness. Every evening when we returned it was like coming home which felt so good. Mystic is an excellent value for money. I fully recommend it to anyone who is looking for a simple, clean accommodation and who does not have walking problems (there are winding stairs and no lift). We much hope to come back some day. Pavla & Katka, Slovakia

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: SitiRohani
Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul a few times and I must say Mystic really gives value for money. The room I got was modest but the location of the hotel plus the view of the Marmara Sea while having breakfast was priceless. It's located in a residential area off the Hippodrome in Sultanahmet. So you go back to your hotel in the evening like going home when there are children playing outside and moms and pops are just having chats with neighbours. The only downside is the renovation going on next door which was okay for me as I was out while they were working. It felt more like a homestay as the family is always around to help you or you can just hang around the lobby and watch tv together with them. As a solo female traveller, I felt safe to be going home there every evening. I can't help feeling that Oktay was also looking out that his single travellers are okay on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen092
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely family run hotel very close to the main sights. Otkay and his family are very welcoming and helpful. The hotel has lots of character and the rooms are all individually decorated. The sea view rooms have air con, but the bigger rooms without a seaview don't. We didn't have aircon, but it was ok actually. Our room had a minibar which was great value, same prices as the local shops which is incedible for a minibar! The terrace is lovely and a great place to sit out in the evening watching the ships on the Sea of Marmara. We will def go back and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good choice for accomodation in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: lafuentedelavida
Reviews.Content: Very good location, nice terrace to have breakfast at, clean rooms and very helpful and lovely family running this hotel. Best prices-quality found over the area. I'd go back there again!!!.Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!!”
Reviews.Author: Maitita
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and the hotel was right in the centre which made really easy to get to places. Lovely breakfast and great value!! Totally worth it! The owner spoke very good English and helped us with directions. ************

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean, and cute”
Reviews.Author: BootsMadeforTravelin
Reviews.Content: My mother and I traveled to Istanbul for the first time for a 4 night vacation, and ended up here after our booking agent said there were no 4 star hotels in Sultanahment with available rooms and wanted to book us at a place in Taksim instead. We really wanted to be within walking distance of the cultural sites, so we asked for a 3 star place in the historic district, and we're very glad we decided to stay in the area. The hotel is in a great location - a 5 or 10 minute walk to the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Arasta Bazaar, and Grand Palace Mosaics Museum, and about a 15 minute walk to the Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, and the Basilica Cistern. It's also a 10-15 minute walk to the tram line and Grand Bazaar. It's on a small side residential street, so you don't get noise from crowds or traffic, which is a plus. There is a view of the Marmara Sea from one side of the hotel and from the outdoor terrace where they serve breakfast. Breakfast is nice - all cold, but a perfectly good start to the day - bread, yogurt, cheese, cold cut meat, tomatoes, olives, fresh fruit, jams, juice, tea, coffee. The rooms were cute - average size (not cramped, not huge), with high wood paneled ceilings, and hardwood floors with an oriental rug. We had asked for a room with two twin beds and got a room with three, which was great. There was a wardrobe and shelves and a TV, as well as a nightstand and lamp. We also had a lot of windows, so the room got nice light, and there were embroidered sheers for privacy. The curtains did a good job of shielding the light in the morning when we were sleeping. The bathroom looked new and had a roomy floor-level shower with lots of hot water and a Western toilet. There is wireless Internet, but we didn't use that since we weren't traveling with our computers, so I can't comment on how well it worked. We only had two complaints. First, the hotel is three floors (no elevator) and has difficult stairs. It's a gorgeous spiral staircase with marble steps, but it's steep and twisty and doesn't have a handrail all along it; plus, there are motion-sensor lights that don't activate until you're halfway up the flight of steps, so you have to navigate in low light sometimes. This was a very minor issue for me as a 20something, but my 60 year old mother had difficulty with it, and I imagine it could be hazardous for the elderly or little kids. The only other issue we had was the bed linens. The beds were only outfitted with a flat (not fitted) sheet on the mattress and a thin blanket. We missed the usual top sheet, and kept having to tuck in and reposition the bottom sheet since it wasn't fitted. I'm guessing this is a local custom, but as exhausted tourists, we would have appreciated Western bedding. Also, the thin blanket wasn't enough for me for the cool nights - however, I used the blanket from the third bed, and I imagine they would have given us an extra one if we had asked. Overall, we felt this was a good value in a great spot, and we liked that it was family-run. It's always nice to support family businesses, and Otkay, the owner, was clearly dedicated. With the addition of a complete handrail on the stairs and Western bedding, this place would be absolutely fantastic! As it is, I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Centric,lovely owners,nice rooms,perfect terrace”
Reviews.Author: MayWhatever
Reviews.Content: We went a group of 9 friends and we enjoyed a lot in this hotel. They were very welcoming, gave good tips for the city, maps, etc, very helpful, even he went with us to the grand bazar and turkish bath. His English is quite good too. The rooms were cozy, some bigger and some smaller but really nice. And the terrace was amazing for a break if you want to smoke a cigarrette or drink a tea. Very centric,with a beautiful mosque in the corner and 2 minutes from the Blue Mosque. I recommend this hotel to everybody (groups, friends, family, couples...). If I come back to Istanbul, I'll stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, lovely people!”
Reviews.Author: STCLondon
Reviews.Content: Friendly and hassle free; comfortable, basic and excellent value. Easy walking distance of main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fluent English speaking host”
Reviews.Author: redlemon19
Reviews.Content: I booked directly from Oktay for 3 families. We had a stopover in Istanbul before a sailing holiday. I looked through all the reviews and decided that it is the place to go. We only needed:comfortable bed, no noise and clen shower. We have got it. I was in doubt of the freshness of bed linnen but realised after thorough exploration that it was just not ironed. Which is Ok my household and generally accepted for the money we paid for our stay and Oktay's family afforts to run the business. Hope they are profitable! They are hard workers. Breakfast is basic, but again for the money we paid - worth it. Oktay speaks very good English and probably French. All his recommendation where to go, what to see, where to eat appeared to be extremely useful. Their neighbours are doing constraction works, only once during our 5 days stay they woke us up at 8, The rest of the days they have been quiet. The street has no traffic at all so the the only noise would be a song from the mosque at about 5 am which is unavoidable in any place in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly and helpful family running an authentic hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Lazas
Reviews.Content: Booked via the internet, and personal confirmation email within 24 hours. Wonderfully welcomed by Oktay Balkir on arrival. Room cozy, hot shower and with great view of the Marmara sea. Clean and comfortable room. Great location just a pleasant short stroll to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, B Cisterns and tram line. Oktay and his lovely wife and daughters were wonderful hosts. Insightful about local news and very helpful with local and national tours, from information to booking. If we are fortunate enough to return to Turkey, we look forward to returning for a stay here and ask Oktay to help us with our tours through Turkey. Great value for money and strongly recommended. Thanks Balkir's, Rowen and KJ Lazarus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Value for money”
Reviews.Author: borgkye2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel thru email and was well entertained by the owner Oktay Balkir. We had a clean room with nice hot shower. For the price of the room you are only 10 minutes away from the main tourists attractions in Sultanahmet district. If you are a first timer like us, your best bet would be to stay here and talk to Oktay of what you want to do there, from places to go and things to buy, he will give you good advice. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay there, and will surely return. Thanks Oktay. I Ahmad, Malaysia
